chapter.title: Replication
chapter.para: Replication (short for 'backlog replication') is the system that stores certain IRC lines and then sends them to the user at a certain moment.
Additionally, there is a `BACKLOG' command available thru remote administration.

sect1.title: Highlighted words
sect1.para: Replicate only lines that match certain patterns

sect1.title: Simple replication
sect1.para: All lines that were sent after the last time you disconnected a client are stored and sent to a client that connects to ctrlproxy.

sect1.title: Limited lines replication
sect1.para: Provides limited replication (only sends messsages and notices and initial join, no changes).

sect1.title: Since last disconnect
sect1.para: All lines that were sent after the last time you disconnected a client are stored and sent to a client that connects to ctrlproxy.

sect1.title: Time reporter
sect1.para: Very simple module that prints the time before every message. Such messages are very useful for backlogs. That way, you can know at approximately which time something was said.
